scheduler.name: scx_flash
scheduler.description: An EDF (Earliest Deadline First) scheduler that assigns dynamic latency weights based on CPU usage patterns. Tasks that release CPU early receive higher latency weights, prioritizing them over tasks that consume full time slices. Deadlines are calculated as vruntime + exec_vruntime, ensuring fairness while prioritizing latency-sensitive tasks.
scheduler.characteristics: dynamic latency weights, early cpu release priority, fairness focused, vruntime tracking, exec_vruntime accounting, voluntary context switch credits

slice_us_lag.description: Maximum runtime budget accumulation while sleeping

run_us_lag.description: Maximum runtime penalty accumulation while running

max_avg_nvcsw.description: Maximum rate of voluntary context switches

cpu_busy_thresh.description: CPU utilization threshold for busy detection (-1 = auto)

scheduler.limitations: May not optimize for pure throughput, complex latency weight tuning
scheduler.performance_profile: optimized for low latency and predictable performance
